abstract: Hernán E. Arbizu, a private banker to wealthy clients, says he shifted money to make good on unrealistic investment promises.
snippet: Hernán E. Arbizu, a private banker to wealthy clients, says he shifted money to make good on unrealistic investment promises.
lead_paragraph: He grew up in elite circles in Buenos Aires, acquiring the polish and privileged connections that paved the way for him to become a star private banker in New York to wealthy clients at UBS and JPMorgan Chase.

byline.original: By Lynnley Browning and Diana B. Henriques

abstract: The curious case of Hernan E. Arbizu, a private banker who says he illegally took millions of dollars from his wealthy clients at UBS and JPMorgan Chase, raises questions about how carefully some institutions monitor their bankers.
snippet: The curious case of Hernan E. Arbizu, a private banker who says he illegally took millions of dollars from his wealthy clients at UBS and JPMorgan Chase, raises questions about how carefully some institutions monitor their bankers.
lead_paragraph: He grew up in elite circles in Buenos Aires, acquiring the polish and privileged connections that paved the way for him to become a star private banker in New York to wealthy clients at UBS and JPMorgan Chase.

abstract: JPMorgan Chase is cutting its ties with a $600 million-plus private equity fund run by former Citigroup executives Robert B. Willumstad and Marjorie Magner, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase is cutting its ties with a $600 million-plus private equity fund run by former Citigroup executives Robert B. Willumstad and Marjorie Magner, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase is cutting its ties with a $600 million-plus private equity fund run by two former Citigroup executives, Robert B. Willumstad and Marjorie Magner, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: JPMorgan Said to Wind Down Brysam Capital
